item.title: مندوب مبيعات مولدات ومحركات
item.description:
شركة ليبية كبري وكيل لماركة امريكية كبري لاستيراد المولدات والآليات بمدينة طرابلس ترغب في توظيف مندوب مبيعات مولدات ومحركات حسب الشروط التالية: – المستوى التعليمي: شهادة في الهندسة – الاختصاص: هندسة كهربائية / أو الطاقة / أو ميكانيكية – اللغة الإنجليزية: جيد جدا – الخبرة: من سنة إلى سنتين – العمل بدوام كامل – لا نقبل من له تعيين في جهة أخرى (ازدواجية) مكان العمل الكريمية

The post مندوب مبيعات مولدات ومحركات first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
شركة ليبية كبري وكيل لماركة امريكية كبري لاستيراد المولدات والآليات بمدينة طرابلس ترغب في توظيف مندوب مبيعات مولدات ومحركات حسب الشروط التالية:

– المستوى التعليمي: شهادة في الهندسة

– الاختصاص: هندسة كهربائية / أو الطاقة / أو ميكانيكية

– اللغة الإنجليزية: جيد جدا

– الخبرة: من سنة إلى سنتين

– العمل بدوام كامل

– لا نقبل من له تعيين في جهة أخرى (ازدواجية)

مكان العمل الكريمية – طرابلس

علي الراغبين في التقدم الي هذة الوظيفة تعبئة النموذج التالي : https://forms.gle/ba9TkhpBK7RnFJWc9

او ارسال السيرة الذتية الي : halima@libyanjobs.ly

item.title: Digital Media Assistant
item.description:
Position details Login and apply Vacancy id VAC-7656 Job title VAC-7656 Digital Media Assistant Location Benghazi Apply by 10-Jul-2022 Start date 11-Jul-2022 Duration – Number of vacancies 1 Qualification Bachelor’s in Media, Public Relations, Social Sciences, International Relations or a related field from an accredited academic institution, with 4 years of relevant professional experience or (essential). High School in High

The post Digital Media Assistant first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
Position details

Login and apply
Vacancy id VAC-7656
Job title VAC-7656 Digital Media Assistant
Location Benghazi
Apply by 10-Jul-2022
Start date 11-Jul-2022
Duration –
Number of vacancies 1
Qualification Bachelor’s in Media, Public Relations, Social Sciences, International Relations or a related field from an accredited academic institution, with 4 years of relevant professional experience or (essential).
High School in High school degree with 6 years of relevant professional work experience. (essential).
Sector experience Minimum of 3 year/s of demonstrable relevant Communication experience (essential).
Minimum of 3 year/s of demonstrable relevant Advocacy / Human Rights experience (essential).
Geographical experience Minimum of 3 year/s of experience in MENA (essential).
Languages Fluent in English (essential).
Fluent in Arabic (essential).
Working level in French (desirable).

Job description

CTG overview CTG staff and support humanitarian projects in fragile and conflict-affected countries around the world, providing a rapid and cost-effective service for development and humanitarian missions. With past performance in 17 countries – from the Middle East, Africa, Europe, and Asia, we have placed more than 20,000 staff all over the world since operations began in 2006.

CTG recruits, deploys and manages the right people with the right skills to implement humanitarian and development projects, from cleaners to obstetricians, and mechanics to infection specialists, we’re skilled in emergency response to crises such as the Ebola outbreak in West Africa. Key to successful project delivery is the ability to mobilise at speed; CTG can source and deploy anyone, anywhere, in less than 2 weeks and have done so in 48 hours on a number of occasions.

Through our efficient and agile HR, logistical and operational services, CTG saves multilateral organisations time and money. We handle all our clients’ HR related issues, so they are free to focus on their core services.

Visit www.ctg.org to find out more
Overview of position Under the direct supervision of the Public Information Officer and the overall supervision of the Head of PDSU and COM, the Digital Media Assistant will provide assistance for related activities and will ensure that cooperation with implementing partners is according to agreed action plans.
Role objectives
  1. Produce content for international audiences in the form of assisting to develop press notes and creating visual human-interest stories from the field; 

  1. Visit the field to collect photographs, video clips, beneficiaries’ stories and program descriptions that highlight IOM Libya’s presence and overall strategy for the Mission’s publications and communication channels; 

 

  1. On a weekly basis capture and edit photos and videos about IOM activities, and produce at least one finalized story to be posted on the Mission’s social media platforms each week; 

  1. On a monthly basis collect, edit, and produce a video story about IOM activities related to specific project or donor specific requirement; 

 

 

  1. Provide general advice on content sharing and ways to engage public and followers with the organization’s different platforms for a growing audience; 

 

  1. Supports digital campaigns in support of IOM’s interventions and beneficiaries – in collaboration with other communication offices, if needed; 

 

  1. Monitor social media channels, and flag any issues of concern to the PI team, including negative mentions and misreporting, and propose ways to respond appropriately; 

 

  1. Be responsible for building a pool of photos and videos of IOM activities on a timely basis; make sure that IOM Libya at all times has access to latest high-quality photos about the field activities; 

 

  1. Contribute to the inclusion of appropriate gender awareness in IOM Libya PI material; 

 

  1. Support PI training for field staff on photography, story collection and videography, and build internal PI capacity; 

 

  1. Work closely with IOM Libya operational colleagues to cover IOM activities with text and audio-visual material, including for visiting detention centres and other relevant locations; 

 

  1. Build relationships and collaborations with universities and local media outlets; 

 

  1. Identify relevant media/communications opportunities to promote IOM Libya’s work in Libya; 

 

  1. Ensure consistent visibility of IOM Libya’s activities in the field and produced material; 

 

  1. Ensure donor visibility in line with donor guidelines; 

 

  1. Perform such other duties as may be assigned. 
Project reporting N/A
Key competencies  

 

The incumbent is expected to demonstrate the following values and competencies: 

 

 

 

Values – all IOM staff members must abide by and demonstrate these three values:

 

 

  • Inclusion and respect for diversity: respects and promotes individual and cultural differences; encourages diversity and inclusion wherever possible. 
  • Integrity and transparency: maintains high ethical standards and acts in a manner consistent with organizational principles/rules and standards of conduct. 
  • Professionalism: demonstrates ability to work in a composed, competent and committed manner and exercises careful judgment in meeting day-to-day challenges. 

Core Competencies – behavioural indicators level 3

 

 

  • Teamwork: develops and promotes effective collaboration within and across units to achieve shared goals and optimize results.
    • Delivering results: produces and delivers quality results in a service-oriented and timely manner; is action oriented and committed to achieving agreed outcomes. 
    • Managing and sharing knowledge: continuously seeks to learn, share knowledge and innovate. 
    • Accountability: takes ownership for achieving the Organization’s priorities and assumes responsibility for own action and delegated work. 
    • Communication: encourages and contributes to clear and open communication; explains complex matters in an informative, inspiring and motivational way. 

 

 

 
Team management N/A
Further information Education:

· Bachelor’s degree in Media, Public Relations, Social Sciences, International Relations or a related field from an accredited academic institution, with 4 years of relevant professional experience or;

 

· High school degree with 6 years of relevant professional work experience.

 

Experience:

· Experience working in communications, advocacy, journalism or related area is required;

 

 

· Fully proficient computer skills including use of relevant softwares and other applications (e.g. Adobe Suite including Photoshop, Premiere or Final Cut) is required;

 

 

· Experience of producing visual communication products is desirable;

 

 

· Previous working experience in a relevant field with an international organization (IOM, UN etc.) is an advantage;

 

 

Skills:

 

· Good knowledge of MS Office applications e.g. Excel, Word, Outlook, etc.

 

 

 

· Effective organizational skills and ability to establish priorities and plans, ability to work under pressure and cope with deadlines;

 

 

 

· Good written and spoken communications skills, good interpersonal skills, ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.
Disclaimer: At no stage of the recruitment process will CTG ask candidates for a fee. This includes during the application stage, interview, assessment and training.

The post Digital Media Assistant first appeared on Libyanjobs.

item.title: Peacebuilding Coordinator
item.description:
Peacebuilding Coordinator Organization Danish Refugee Council Posted 26 Jun 2022 Closing date 29 Jun 2022 Job details Countries Libya Tunisia City Tunis, with frequent travel to Libya Source Danish Refugee Council Type Job Career category Program/Project Management Years of experience 5-9 years Theme Peacekeeping and Peacebuilding Danish Refugee Council, one of the world’s leading humanitarian NGOs, is currently looking for a highly

The post Peacebuilding Coordinator first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
Peacebuilding Coordinator

Organization Danish Refugee Council
Posted 26 Jun 2022

Closing date 29 Jun 2022


Job details

Countries Libya Tunisia
City Tunis, with frequent travel to Libya
Source Danish Refugee Council
Type Job
Career category Program/Project Management
Years of experience 5-9 years
Theme Peacekeeping and Peacebuilding

Danish Refugee Council, one of the world’s leading humanitarian NGOs, is currently looking for a highly qualified Peacebuilding Coordinator to ensure quality standards and innovative approaches in the implementation of the Libya DRC Humanitarian Disarmament and Peacebuilding programme.

About the job:

As DRC Libya Peacebuilding Coordinator you are responsible for the strategic development and technical supervision of the Peacebuilding-Community Safety activities which aim at strengthening the resilience and social cohesion of conflict affected communities via participatory processes, conflict analysis and management as well as security governance. In line with DRC Humanitarian Disarmament and Peacebuilding (HDP) sector approach, you are ultimately responsible in ensuring the high quality of the Peacebuilding-Community Safety programme, providing technical guidance and building the team capacity along the project cycle management phases. You are also shaping the strategic development of DRC Peacebuilding-Community safety sector and its contribution to DRC presence in the country in line with DRC advocacy and programme strategy.

Your main duties and responsibilities will be:

  • Lead and provide technical guidance to the development of the Peacebuilding-Community Safety programme in Libya, including the definition of the programme strategy and its contribution to DRC Libya goals and fundraising efforts.
  • Provide high quality programme and reporting standards and contribute to the implementation of MEAL tools and practices for the Peacebuilding-Community Safety activities in Libya.
  • Monitor the peace and conflict context in the country, internally coordinate and externally represent the organization and programme in line with DRC advocacy and strategy with regards to your sector.
  • Capacity building of the Peacebuilding-Community Safety team in conflict sensitivity, management and resolution and other relevant modules.
  • Contributing to the conflict sensitivity objectives of DRC programme in Libya with protocols in place and trainings.

About you:

To be successful in this role we expect you to have experience in conflict sensitivity and management, expertise in strategic programme development and implementation with a focus on civil society engagement in communities impacted by the consequences of armed violence.

Moreover, we also prefer you to possess the following:

Required

  • Excellent understanding of working on peace, conflict management, security governance issues and armed violence impact on community safety and cohesion in complex conflict settings.
  • Previous experience in complex humanitarian-development crisis impacted by conflict.
  • Excellent leadership, coordination, communication, planning and capacity building skills.
  • Excellent strategic, analytical and writing skills.
  • Experience in facilitation of workshops and delivery of trainings.

Desirable

  • Previous experience in Libya.
  • Experience and skills in conflict related data management and visualization systems.

In this position, you are expected to demonstrate DRC’ five core competencies:

Striving for excellence: You focus on reaching results while ensuring an efficient process.

Collaborating: You involve relevant parties and encourage feedback.

Taking the lead: You take ownership and initiative while aiming for innovation.

Communicating: You listen and speak effectively and honestly.

Demonstrating integrity: You uphold and promote the highest standards of ethical and professional conduct in relation to our values and Code of Conduct, including safeguarding against sexual exploitation, abuse and harassment.

We offer

Contract length: 12 months

Designation of Duty Station: Unaccompanied

Start date: July 2022

Salary and conditions will be in accordance with Danish Refugee Council’s Terms of Employment for Expatriates; please refer to drc.ngo under Vacancies.

How to apply

Application process:

All applicants must upload a cover letter and an updated CV (no longer than four pages) in English. Applications sent by email will not be considered.

Closing date for applications: 29 June 20022

For further information about the Danish Refugee Council, please consult our website drc.ngo.

https://candidate.hr-manager.net/ApplicationForm/SinglePageApplicationForm.aspx?cid=1036&departmentId=19125&ProjectId=164330

The post Peacebuilding Coordinator first appeared on Libyanjobs.

item.title: HR Administrator
item.dc:creator: AlRaied Energy
item.description:
AlRaied group of company is looking for a qualified employee for our HR Department Job Description Support the development and implementation of HR initiatives and system Provide counseling on policies and procedures Involved in recruitment by preparing job descriptions, posting ads, and managing the hiring process Create and implement effective onboarding plans Making sure staff are getting paid correctly on

The post HR Administrator first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
AlRaied group of company is looking for a qualified employee for our HR Department

Job Description

  • Support the development and implementation of HR initiatives and system
  • Provide counseling on policies and procedures
  • Involved in recruitment by preparing job descriptions, posting ads, and managing the hiring process
  • Create and implement effective onboarding plans
  • Making sure staff are getting paid correctly on time
  • Develop training and development program
  • Assist the performance management of disciplinary and grievance issues
  • Maintain employee records
  • Review employment and working conditions to ensure legal compliance

 

Job Requirements

  1. Proven work experience as an HR Administrator, HRAssistant or relevant role
  2. Experiences with HR software, like HRIS or HRMS
  3. Computer literacy (MS Office applications, in particular)
  4. Excellent organizational skills, with an ability to prioritize important projects
  5. Strong phone, email, and in-person communication skills
  6. Bachelor degree
  7. English language

Contact

Email: raj@raiedgroup.com

WhatsApp: 0944437913 ( use only to send CVs and personal info. No Phone calls)

The post HR Administrator first appeared on Libyanjobs.

item.title: Senior IP Engineer New
item.dc:creator: Huawei Libya office
item.description:
About the job Key Responsibilities :- Customer Engagement Solution Design Internal & External Stakeholder Engagement Customer Proposal Access Price/Supplier Negotiation Order Form Creation Order Form Processing Supplier & Customer) Stakeholder in MSA Review and Partner onboarding   Presales ‐ Solution Develop, design and implement solutions for our customers telecommunications & ICT requirements Interface between sales and the rest of GBI

The post Senior IP Engineer New first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
About the job

Key Responsibilities :-

Customer Engagement

Solution Design

Internal & External Stakeholder Engagement

Customer Proposal

Access Price/Supplier Negotiation

Order Form Creation

Order Form Processing Supplier & Customer)

Stakeholder in MSA Review and Partner onboarding

 

Presales ‐ Solution

Develop, design and implement solutions for our customers telecommunications & ICT requirements

Interface between sales and the rest of GBI to provide the necessary solution

End to End owner of a sales opportunity to deliver the best in class solution to maximize win probability

Engage commercial, technical, legal, financial stakeholders to get necessary sign off for the offer

Ensure proper handover to delivery team with necessary documentation, support, sign off to kick start the project

Provide support when needed during the lifecycle of the project (through change management)

Manage the day‐to‐day operations of the Bid Assigned

Conduct sales bidding process and develop selection criteria and methodology for each stage of the evaluation process

Manage the commercial and technical aspect of the bidders including negotiations

Maintain a strong relationship with strategic partners and keep them informed of additional business opportunities

Act as the link between the technical, sales and marketing functions during the pre‐sales and bid process

Direct customers on solutions and propositions

 

Presales – Access Management

Provides Access Pricing and Solution for Customer Projects

Maintains an up‐to‐date database of submarine cable & access network availability and pricing.

Assists in procurement of capacity in order to optimize technological parameters and priorities of GBI Projects.

Verifies the invoices of capacity purchase for certification and maintains database of certified payments.

Verify the agreements and coordinate with contracts.

Updates and maintains database for the availability and pricing details of all submarine cable and Partner Access Networks.

Closely coordinates with other teams within Presales and suppliers for new capacity purchase and closures.

Prepare Conversion Forms/ SOF etc. to facilitate the activation of capacity

Verifies invoices of capacity purchases and certification of invoices for payments; maintains database of payments certified.

Assist in preparing the capacity dashboard in all existing cables and Access.

Performs any other related duties as required.

 

Education and Experience:

Have a Bachelor degree from recognized educational institutions. Preferred disciplines include: Engineering, computing and Business degree.

Have 6-9 years of Global Solutions and Pricing experience in Telecommunications industry.

Have experience and understanding of cost models and cost saving execution.

Have proven understanding of any Telco domain, including Fixed Network, Transmission/Transport, SDWAN, IOT & IP technologies.

Have proven success managing telco Customers and international contracts.

Have the ability to confidently interact, communicate and collaborate effectively with stakeholders across key business functions.

Have intermediate-level proficiency in Microsoft Excel.

Be able to maintain high personal and professional standards.

Have the ability to work in a dynamic/fast paced environment, high level of autonomy.

Have excellent written and oral presentation skills.

Have good understanding of different product solutions and map Customer requirement’s within the Product offerings, to cater to Customer needs with optimized cost.

Be willing to challenge ‘business as usual’; curiosity to think ‘outside the box’ and passion for driving improvements. Ability to be creative to meet business needs, but also pragmatic and results oriented.

Be able to adjust communications style to different audiences.

Have sound judgment and decision making among competing demands.

For the applicate that fit job profile , please send it directly to recruiter email . Libyainterns@huawei.com

HR deputy at Huawei

The post Senior IP Engineer New first appeared on Libyanjobs.

item.title: Center Manager -Tripoli
item.dc:creator: INTESOS
item.description:
Position: Centre Manager Duty station: Tripoli – Libya Report to: Project Manager Status: Full time Job Purpose: In accordance with the instructions received by and under the supervision of INTERSOS Project Manager, the Centre Manager will be responsible for the planning and implementation of all INTERSOS educational and protection activities within the centre. Currently this includes learning support services

The post Center Manager -Tripoli first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
Position: Centre Manager

Duty station: Tripoli – Libya

Report to: Project Manager

Status: Full time

Job Purpose:

In accordance with the instructions received by and under the supervision of INTERSOS Project Manager, the Centre Manager will be responsible for the planning and implementation of all INTERSOS educational and protection activities within the centre. Currently this includes learning support services and PSS activities, alternative educational and protection pathways.

He/She will ensure provision of a safe and quality educational learning environment which fosters a sense of comfort, security and a sense of normalcy and will work to improve the level of general well-being of children and youth in the centre.

Generic Duties:

The Centre Manager will provide overall supervision, mentoring and support to all the INTERSOS staff deployed in Baity centre. S/he will also guarantee proper evaluation of the impact of the intervention. The Centre Manager is responsible for all matters related to the Centre, including:

  • Manage center’s effective functioning, physical safety, and activities conduction.
  • Participate in recruitment of all center staff, according to INTERSOS principles and standards.
  • Plan, design and implement interactive teaching and learning strategies designed to enhance learning, improve the overall well-being of students, and encourage a sense of normalcy for vulnerable children.
  • Guarantee the implementation of the SOPs about CP/GBV procedures and the standard of quality of the activities in terms of PSS, Education, referral system and coordination.
  • Ensure coordination with other (education/protection) and other service providers in the same area if any.
  • Promote and support adherence to agreed interagency Child Protection standards.

Specific Duties:

  • With the support and under the supervision of the Project Manager, design and follow up the plan of actions to guide and monitor the implementation of education and protection activities.
  • Supervise social workers and monitor the activities and ensure achieving the project’s objectives according to the agreed-on indicators.
  • Ensure equal access for girls and boys through intensive community outreach, arranging and providing other gender-based considerations as deemed necessary.
  • Manage scheduling, attendance and performance of all educational centre staff
  • Provide support through guidance and advice for teachers/social workers, outreach workers and facilitators as needed.
  • Identify skills that need improvement and development within the main subjects taught in the centre and according to the context.
  • Sensitize the community informing about the center activities and encouraging participation;
  • Design a variety of entertainment and attractive activities for students.
  • Provide to INTERSOS detailed weekly report including all data, activities and events that have been carried out during the whole week.
  • Prepare monthly comprehensive report regarding activities, achievements, progress and challenges to be shared with the Project Manager

In addition, the CENTRE Manager will have the following specific responsibilities:

  • Security Focal Point, in case of any emergency with the responsibility to provide instructions and direction to all the people present in the centre.
  • In collaboration with the Project Manager and the Deputy Branch Manager, interact with Local Authorities and community for any matter related to the Centre.

S/he will perform any other tasks requested by the supervisor in the framework of the activities foreseen by INTERSOS program in Libya.

INTERSOS value & responsibilities:

  • Uphold the INTERSOS Code of Conduct and policies;
  • Ensure the respect of the core humanitarian principles: neutrality, impartiality, independence and humanity and the respect of the “do no harm” principle of humanitarian action.
  • Strictly follow the internal procedures and guidelines and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs);

HOW TO APPLY

Interested candidates are invited to submit CV and motivational letter via email to admin.libya@intersos.org, with the subject line “Center Manager Tripoli ”.

The deadline for the application is 16/05/2022

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for the first interview.

INTERSOS has a zero-tolerance policy toward Sexual Exploitation and Abuse.
Protection from Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA) is everyone’s responsibility, and all staff are required to adhere to the Code of Conduct, that enshrines principle of PSEA, always (both during working hours and outside working hours).

Familiarisation with and adherence to the Code of Conduct is an essential requirement of all staff, in addition to the related mandatory training. All staff must ensure that they understand and act in accordance with this clause.

The post Center Manager -Tripoli first appeared on Libyanjobs.

item.title: مندوبة مبيعات لمنطقة غرب طرابلس (قرجي-حي الأندلس-السياحية…)
item.dc:creator: نيروز القيروان
item.description:
تعلن شركة نيروز القيروان للمستحضرات الطبية والعناية بالبشرة طرابلس عن حاجتها لمندوبة مبيعات لمنطقة غرب طرابلس (قرجي – حي الأندلس – السياحية) :ويشترط أن يكون المتقدم للطلب ذو سيرة ذاتية جيدة – يفضل أن يكون خريج أحد التخصصات الطبية – يمتلك مهارات التفاوض والإقناع – يمتلك سيارة خاصة – على من يرى في نفسه الرغبة والكفاءة للعمل داخل الفريق إرسال

The post مندوبة مبيعات لمنطقة غرب طرابلس (قرجي-حي الأندلس-السياحية…) first appeared on Libyanjobs.
item.content:encoded:
تعلن شركة نيروز القيروان للمستحضرات الطبية والعناية بالبشرة طرابلس عن حاجتها لمندوبة مبيعات لمنطقة غرب طرابلس (قرجي – حي الأندلس – السياحية)

:ويشترط أن يكون المتقدم للطلب

ذو سيرة ذاتية جيدة –

يفضل أن يكون خريج أحد التخصصات الطبية –

يمتلك مهارات التفاوض والإقناع –

يمتلك سيارة خاصة –

على من يرى في نفسه الرغبة والكفاءة للعمل داخل الفريق إرسال السيرة الذاتية عبر البريد الالكتروني

أو عبر تطبيق الوا تس اب0928331452 Nayrouzealkayrawen@yahoo.com

The post مندوبة مبيعات لمنطقة غرب طرابلس (قرجي-حي الأندلس-السياحية…) first appeared on Libyanjobs.
